overall_summary: The reasoning focuses on handling hourly time-series data with daily seasonality using simple averaging due to limited historical data (4 days). The approach prioritizes practicality over complex models, emphasizing missing value awareness and daily pattern extraction. While SARIMA and exponential smoothing were considered, the solution adopted a heuristic method suitable for short-term forecasting with clear but variable daily cycles.
common_data_patterns: Missing value awareness and imputation readiness
Consistent hourly patterns with daily variation
No clear long-term trend in 4-day window
key_insights: Hourly averaging across multiple days as baseline forecasting
Explicit handling of potential missing values in source data
Rejection of weekly seasonality modeling due to insufficient data
Trade-off analysis between model complexity and data limitations
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with detailed hourly pattern analysis, statistical averaging calculations, and consideration of multiple modeling approaches before selecting a practical heuristic solution. Combines data observation with methodological trade-off evaluation.
